status_notes: Case Closed. VIOISS: Violation Filed.
description:
This isn't the only location, there are a number of areas that are rarely shoveled completely along Hyde Park Ave on the route to Forest Hills station.  I wasn't going to report anyone, in part because there are several houses and businesses culpable and it would mean a series of reports...  

I changed my mind after slipping again on the ice on my way back from the station.  Too many people use that stretch of sidewalk (about a mile leading up to FH station) and it's ridiculous that it's as icy as it always is.  If someone can go up Hyde Park and talk to people or issue citations or something and get the sidewalks clear enough to be safe-ish, it would be much appreciated! Right now it feels like a treacherous gamble with death to walk to the T. I'd rather save that  for when I'm already ON the T! Ha. :-)  Thanks!

status_notes: Case Closed. VIOISS: Violation Filed.
description:
Unshoveled location: [Sidewalk]  Exact location: []  Details: [Unpassable sidewalk in the area of 181 Bowdoin St. in Dorchester.  

	
As I was walking on Bowdoin St. this morning, I came upon a long stretch of sidewalk that was impassable. Not a single snow flake had been removed from it since the snow stopped falling a week ago.  I had to walk onto the busy road on Bowdoin St, dodging the fast moving cars and buses. It’s a dangerous situation.  I took a picture to report it. 
 
As I took that picture, there was a kid trudging through the snow trying to catch his school bus –see attached pic.   One of his shoes got caught, and he fell face first into the frozen snow. I offered to help him, but he declined.  He eventually picked himself up, walked barefoot to retrieve his lost shoe with one barefoot, emptied the shoe filled with snow, and made his way into the bus.  At best, he probably ended up with a wet and frozen foot for the rest of the day which was quite upsetting to see.
 
When I got home, I looked up the property address, and I found that the absentee owner is now trying to sell it for $1.3 million.  Yet, he can’t be bothered to spend a penny to clear up the snow nor show an ounce of respect for the neighborhood.  
 
http://www.zillow.com/homedetails/171-181-Bowdoin-Boston-dorchester-MA-02124/2109811697_zp id/
 
Although only one address shows up when doing a search (181 Bowdoin St.), the City of Boston website shows that this long section of un-shoveled sidewalk consist of 4 separate commercial properties, all of them belonging to the same “CASSERLY JOHN”.  According to City rule, “Each day that a violation exists is considered a separate and distinct violation”.  Therefore, each one of these four properties should be fined at the $200 commercial rate on a daily basis until that situation is corrected.   This area has been abandoned, neglected, and trashed for many years and there is no reason to believe that this is about to change without giving the owner proper financial incentive.
 
Thank you for reading my long rant, and taking appropriate action!]

Thank you for your attention and cooperation in this matter.  Judith Hurley
P.S. I did call the Mayors' Hotline and was given Claim #1019800]
